keyTakeAways: Ange Postecoglou was dismissed by Nottingham Forest after just 39 days in charge, making it the shortest managerial tenure in Premier League history.
Postecoglou failed to win a single game during his tenure, drawing two and losing six, including a 3-0 defeat to Chelsea.
The club stated that the decision was due to a series of disappointing results and performances.
Postecoglou joined the club after Nuno Espírito Santo’s exit, who had led the team to its best league finish in 30 years.
The Australian manager's dismissal follows a period of poor form and a strained relationship with the club's ownership, as suggested by comments made by Espírito Santo.
This marks the third managerial change at Nottingham Forest this season, reflecting instability in leadership.
The event is notable as the fastest managerial dismissal in Premier League history, beating Les Reed's record by one day.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Ange Postecoglou, the Australian football manager appointed by Nottingham Forest in late 2025, was dismissed after just 39 days in charge following a poor run of results, including a 3-0 defeat to Chelsea. He failed to win a single game during his tenure, drawing two and losing six, prompting the club to announce his immediate departure. This marks the shortest managerial tenure in Premier League history, beating Les Reed’s record by one day. The decision comes after the departure of previous manager Nuno Espírito Santo, who had led the club to its highest league finish in 30 years. The club's instability in leadership has now led to its third managerial change this season, with fans reportedly booing Postecoglou at the final game.
title: Nottingham Forest manager Ange Postecoglou fired after just 39 days at Premier League club
